snippet: Economists cited various possible factors behind the addition of only 115,000 jobs in April, but none are likely to comfort 13.7 million jobless workers.
abstract: Labor Department reports that unemployment rate fell to 8.1 percent in April, as employers added only 115,000 jobs; lower rate reflects fact that an estimated 342,000 Americans have dropped out of the job market altogether.
lead_paragraph: Economists cited various possible factors behind the addition of only 115,000 jobs in April, but none are likely to comfort 13.7 million jobless workers.

headline.seo: April Jobs Report Shows Growth Slowing, With 115,000 New Positions
headline.main: Reasons Abound for Ebb in Job Growth
headline.print_headline: Rate Of Growth In Jobs Slowed For U.S. In April
